conbody.p: JDBC Consumer originfull or incremental modes for queriesJDBC Consumer can perform queries in two modes:

dlentry.dd: When the JDBC Consumer performs an incremental query, it uses the initial offset as the offset value in the first SQL query. As JDBC Consumer completes processing the results of the first query, it saves the last offset value that it processes. When it requests a subsequent query, it returns data after the last-saved offset. You can reset the origin to use the initial offset value.
Use incremental mode when data is appended to the table between queries. By default, JDBC Consumer uses incremental mode.
When the JDBC Consumer performs a full query, it uses the initial offset as the offset value in the SQL query each time it requests data.
Use a full mode when data can change across the table between queries.
